headline: Clear career path and growth but not for the faint of heart
pros:
- Open and transparent company culture
- Close relationships between employees (feels much like a family)
- Clear career path (where you are right now and where you can get to in the long run)
- Exposure to cultures of other SEA countries through cross-country collaborations
cons:
- Employees tend to multitask, taking on work that may not necessarily be part of their scope
- At least in the Philippines, salary is at the low range compared to industry standards

headline: A place to earn money by selling out
pros: Garena pays well, they require you to spend ALL your time working for them and in return they give you decent enough money.
cons: The work culture is quite toxic, upper management doesn't really make decisions, every one tries to pass the buck to someone above them and things get delayed for months. Employees aren't treated well and are often subject to long working hours, plans are changed at the whims of anyone in management leading to un-paid overtime for task monkeys below them.

It is common to be back on public holidays and weekends too. Tis is the case for all depts, esp shared services (data, IT, finance, law, corp). It is the culture set by managemnt.

headline: Awful environment
pros: Nice office in Vietnam: fancy building with a lot of benefit (of that building)
cons:
In Vietnam:
- Low Salary
- OT continously day by day  without any pension
- Ridiculous KPI, and often raise immediately so staffs can not get it
- Bonus depends on how good have you smarmed your manager
- Strong bully office: some people have to do everything and suffer every mistakes, while some do nothing
- Corruption culture: some staffs earns their own money using company's resource. Sometimes managers collaborate
This company can turn you from good to evil.

headline: It's great but not ok

Learning & training
Curve all mathematics 
Superb
cons: Nothing much to see

headline: Stay away from this place that has zero basic respect
pros: Good snacks in the pantry, free monthly massage, decent business travel benefits
cons:
- No basic respect to employees.  You are expected to work OT even you have an approved compassionate leave for major family tragedy and funeral. Right after your compassionate leave, they give you performance evaluation warning that's without a clear expectation and any performance KPIs so you are clueless on what went wrong.

   The reason of such performance warning is you didn't submit a deliverable during your approved leave. 

- You are expected to stay online and be next to your laptop literally 24/7, afterwork, at midnight, in the weekend, during your annual leave even during your sick leave. 

   Your manager will "teach" you that it's normal and part of the company culture to occupy your personal time.

- The late nights here are NOT like just 10pm, late nights are 3am and even 5am. Happen every week. The next day you have to be on time in the office. 

- They require you to work in the weekend like nothing. It's not a common practice to get back the working weekend as extra off in-lieu. You need to fight hard to gain such extra off in-lieu after full day weekend work. 

- Your planned and approved annual leave may be asked to canceled on the day of your leave, or you can be called back from your annual leave if your company needs you. 

It's not a matter of a fast-pacing environment and  workload, these are all just basic human respects.

headline: Excellent Company for Fresh Graduates to learn
pros:
- Good basic salary
- Often to collaborate with other regional team
- Flexible working hour
- There are a lot of Soft Skill Training that you can take (its free)
- lot of freebies (such as snacks, Ice Cream, Lunch & Dinner)
cons:
- There are "Special" Teams that comes from special hiring programs which being treated very differently  (in a good way) than other employees .
- Because of flat company structure, there's only small chance  for promotion. You need to work very hard and compete with others from "Special" Teams. Otherwise if there is management level position available,  someone from "Special" Team will automatically fill it.
- Often needed to work overtime 
-  imbalance & high workload

headline: Very good company
pros: Learn a lot of things, internal sharing and collage that expand your technology view, high efficiency and delivery speed that keep you working and learning, nice colleages
cons: Too many new features going on, less focus on the design and code base, stable position means not much changes on daily work

headline: Depressing Culture, don't bother joining
pros:
- Good snacks, nice office
- Good base salary
cons:
- Do not let their seemingly high base salary fool you (well,  many others match it now). Your annual bonus is around 0.5-1 month on average. No other bonuses. No overtime allowance. 
- They expect you to work overtime a lot. Do not respect personal time AT ALL, whether it's night time or weekend. 
- Bosses give one-way orders, feedback channels are largely ineffective. Some of them are very power thirsty, their employee wellness does not matter as long as they look good in the eye of higher management. And they micro-manage a lot.
- Chinese culture. Expect to hear Chinese in your meetings, a lot.
- Many managers from the company's early days are incompetent. Possess little to none management and technical knowledge. But they rank very high in the company.
- Repetitive tasks. They are very conservative about updating new tech.

headline: Work there for experience only
pros: great atmosphere and decent pay.

headline: Software Engineer
pros:
Free junk snacks and some fruits.  
Free dinner. 
Nice and open office. 
Gym 50% discount. 
Free massage. 
Young colleagues. 
Good working equipments.
cons:
Long working hours. 
High management level has no respect to employees. They just force employees to work till late night like nothing, no overtime money and the next day you have to work like nothing.
Some teams even has to work until 1a.m and they don't have compensation for the next day. 
Manager some times wants to impress the big boss then just put the ridiculous deadline then nobody is allowed to go home before 10p.m in a couple of weeks. 
Chinese exclusive working environment. They just speak Chinese together at the meeting and if you don't understand, screw you. You also have a very very very small chance to be promoted if you aren't Chinese. 
Most of products are cloned from others. 
Bad code base and design. 
And be careful with the notice duration in contract. They keep it long so that if they can't hire people they will force you to stay. But when they can, they will kick you out immediately.

headline: Good company

headline: Run, it's a trap

friendly people
no back stabbing fear
cons:

headline: listen more from your employees
pros:
Garena has a very nice office environment 
good view from the office
most of fellow colleagues around the office are friendly
cons: flat architecture results in poor execution of projects. top management cares only about money, if you speak to them about useful suggestions for improving productivity, they ask you how much the additional cost will be, and no matter how much the cost is, they will decline your advice quoting the company needs money for something else. Decision making is very top down, engineers are not supposed to give advices. They are supposed to code and meet the harsh deadlines.

headline: No concept of work life balance
pros: Software engineer. No politics on my side, which is great. Fellow colleagues are very smart and competent; lots to learn from peers.
cons: Seriously no concept of work life balance. Either understaffed or developing at too fast a pace. Decision-making is very top-down; hardly any involvement from my end. Company-level decisions also not communicated to lower levels. People leave after a short time, and because of too fast a pace of development, code is hard to maintain. No path of progression explained to software engineers. No stake in company.

headline: Very unfair distribution of work
pros: They provide dinner, but only you OT
cons:
Very unfair distribution of work:
1) Gaming division (PC game and mobile game): you could simply find someone playing games and watching TV dramas all day. Sometimes, it is even the whole team playing games whole day
2) Shopee (e-commerce division): There are 3 ppl sending one simple report in turns. Each one send the report for one week. Also, someone like me needs to do multiple jobs and cover for others' mistakes

headline: It is a joke
pros:
- Good office
- Unlimited snacks
- The company is good at offline marketing and BD in local market
cons:
Mangement problem:
- A group of inexperience fresh graduates managed by inexperience middle-management teams. Extremely low working efficiency and no clear job scope.
- Extremely hierarchical, like a family business. People only do what bosses assign them to do.
- low compensation compared to other Internet companies, poor insurance packages.
- The product development is poor, no documentation, always rush for outcomes but turns out generating more bugs, most of the efforts are put on fixing all kinds of bugs rather than move forward. 
- Use outdated technology and tools, resulting in low working efficiency, isolated from rest of the industry, no communication with outside, even have no idea what is happening outside, always stick to the old way, never changed.
Business model:
- Most of the revenue come from LoL alone, exhibiting no sign of developing new way of making money. The company's future depends on Shopee.

headline: Invest in your designers

headline: A Joke.
pros:
Free snacks and fruits.
In-house masseurs.
cons:
I would actually give 0 for rating but there is no such choice.
There is basically no clear career advancement. Just a bunch of young fresh grads cluelessly doing whatever they are assigned to do and a lot of micromanagement going on.
500 bucks medical allowance is like a joke.
Extremely hierarchical, China culture, higher management are all PRCs, and some colleagues have no respect to your privacy at all.
Long working hours. Developers and MA get paid well but it's quite normal for them to stay in office after 10pm.
Their products are mostly rip-off from the big names in China. What they are trying to do is just to replicate the success of those products in SEA.
Join if you are comfortable with China working culture, know how to flatter your boss, and do not need to have a clear boundary between your life and work.

headline: Malaysia branch:Bad pay and too much politics
pros: Occasional free breakfast, pool table, assorted junk food. Figured out that RM500 medical claim per annum + complimentary one check up. min. death insurance covered. Company event.
cons: No panel docs. Majority bad managers that's why this is the only region didn't grow as big as the rest. Facing computer all day but no allowance for optics, no transportation allowances, below the min wages. You must be multitasking handling more jobs that's not in your description.

headline: Challenging and fun place to work
pros:
Young and driven environment
Challenging job scope
Lots of opportunities
Smart colleagues
cons: long working hours, relative low pay

headline: Anonymous
pros: Good company with vibrant environment and spirited colleagues!
cons: Insane workload and too demanding in terms of deadline. Not compensated with anything

headline: Good Environment
pros: Good working environment, nice collegues
cons: long working hours, relative low pay

headline: Business operations
pros: Results driven, merit based, no BS, good for people who are driven to perform, office environment is good, full of perks
cons: Freestyle, not much structured talent development, too tough for people who needs babysitting (this can be pros, depends on what you looking for)

headline: No exposure
pros: friendly colleague with variable snacks
cons: no exposure, no career development

headline: overall
pros: there are a lot of young people, and the learning environment is quite good, we can learn from each other.
cons: we may change our job tasks quite often, and you may not always in change of the things that you need to take care in the beginning, and a lot people left there, so it may difficult to find some specific related person, as they may left already.

headline: Great working enviroment
pros: Great working environment and awesome office
cons: Overall was good. Keep it up!

headline: Good if you're in good position and chinese
pros:
Lot of opportunities. 
Good salary.
Very good place if you join as Management associate
cons:
Obvious unfairness if you're not Chinese.
Bad middle management

headline: Join if you got degree or higher
pros: If you are a degree holder/ Mba you should totally join. Attractive salary. Tons of free food, casual wear (ladies short are allowed)
cons: You need to tap in and out of work, they keep track of your attendance/ working hours :D Totally no career advancement. Poor management. Never really see a Malay in the company before, so don't bother applying if you are Malay.

headline: Great Start-Up!
pros:
> Young, Dynamic, Fast and Challenging
> Big Projects, Great place to search for experience
cons:
> Management system not yet established
> Long work hour

headline: Think More Before You Join
pros: Relatively good working environment, free dinner but only served till 7.30pm, free massage though two times allowed per month
cons: Long working hour. Poor middle management. No clear career path. Strange company culture

headline: Good benefits, prepare to be disillusioned after a couple months
pros:
- wonderful colleagues, including certain team leads 
- good benefits 
- good starting pay if you are a fresh grad from a local uni or an MA 
- swanky and nice office with unlimited food/drinks 
- little to no politics
cons:
- absolutely no career progression or training 
- no fixed job scope. If you're lucky you'll get to stay where you originally were, but be prepared to be thrown anywhere/anything at any time for no reason. Your needs and opinions will not be taken into account at all 
- senior management does not care about you if you're not high enough up the totem pole. 
- be prepared to have your work belittled and your work disrespected in less than subtle ways 
- many many good people are currently leaving because of all these reasons, which just goes to show that even good pay and benefits can only do so much

headline: Good opportunity for short term goal
pros: Competitive salary, young , fast growing.
cons:
Unclear structure. Red tape and rely on management level.
No long term for personal development.

headline: Young and vibrant company
pros: Good working environment and company welfare. Young and vibrant team members. You can learn a lot if you take more initiatives.
cons: Long working hours. Start work late. Not much work life balance. Can be quite stressful because you are multi-tasking all the time.

headline: Great job
pros: wonderful work place and great supervisor, with food and drinks everyday. Great colleagues and team.really love working here.
cons: Intense job and target.With creative project.Will get some pressure if you are not in the right place.work late often

headline: A great place but not so perfect
pros: Vibrant, young company with many possibilities and flexibilities
cons: No a place for long-term personal development

headline: Good opportunities for fresh, but not recommend for experienced
pros: Nice pantry. Team is young and energetic. Good opportunity for fresh.
cons: Structure is not clear. Procedures are unclear and unprofessional. Rapid change happens. Lack of experienced mentors or leaders in some teams.  Mainland China working style.

headline: Strategic Planning Manager
author_position: Strategic Planning Manager, Indonesia Finance Manager
pros:
+ Team is young and dynamic
+ Teamwork is outstanding, everyone will step-up to cover other team members if they have to
cons:
+ Considerable amount of red-tapes for a startup company
+ Unclear hierarchy

headline: Operation associate intern
pros: Fun environment, young vibe, and a lot of snacks in pantry
cons: A little unstable. Everything is changing so fast

headline: Management Associate
pros: Fast growing, flat structure, young company, always have job for you to do
cons: Demanding so need to be very flexible to change, high level of commitment

headline: Good benefits, lots to learn, much power struggle
pros: Competitive Salary. Health Coverage. Free Snacks. Monthly Company Events. Good Brand in SEA & TW
cons: Lots of power struggle. Mainland Chinese - working culture. Relation-based decision making process.

headline: Young and vibrant company
pros:
1) great staff welfare; pantry is very well-stocked
2) good level of autonomy given
3) good exposure, and hence learning opporrunities
cons:
1) hierarchal for a tech company
2) company is flat, may not have many chances to rise up career ladder

headline: Good company for new energetic grads
pros: Face pace work, very good colleagues
cons: Start ups vibes struggling with corporate ambition.

headline: Good environment, challenging work
pros: Good environment and challenging work

headline: Best Tech company in Singapore
pros:
- Management truly care about developing the engineering team.
- Company grows very fast, and working condition has improved tremendously over the years. 
- Opportunities to work on high impact projects, and work on a lot of different things.
- Among companies with highest rate in the market.
cons:
- Engineering culture still needs to be developed. 
- Sometimes career opportunity depends very much on the project you are on.

headline: Finance Dept
pros: Nice and spacious office, impressive range of pantry supplies
cons:
1) unreasonable termination of employees 
2) dictatorship culture (if you have a good immediate boss, good for you, if not good luck)
3) China culture
4) Leaders do not communicate well, not even speaking proper english
5) No proper direction at all, keep giving moving targets

headline: Software developer
pros: Excellent environment to learn, especially for a fresh graduate
cons: Lack of diversity in nationalities

headline: Good for first job. Very stressful and political
pros:
- Fast growing company
- Relatively high pay for MA program
- Good place for first job and starting pay if you join MA program
cons:
- Very stressful workplace
- Lots of politics going on in the company
- The management is biased towards to mainland Chinese. Local Singaporean has little opportunity here.

headline: Product Associate
pros: Full of challenge, full of talents.
cons: Very stressful but also very interesting

headline: management associate program
pros:

headline: Good and highly recommended
pros:
Good office environment, a lot of room for creativity.
Unlimited supply of food in the pantry.
Young and vibrant team
cons: Gender balance might be an issue here. A lot of guys, but I guess it's the same for all IT industries.

headline: Awesome company
pros: Global Opportunity, fast growing industry.
cons: Sometimes it requires you to work long hours

headline: Good first job, not recommended to stay for long
pros:
Good opening pay
Good company reputation adds to portfolio
Good facilities
cons:
Poor work life balance
Almost close to no career progression

headline: Not that good
pros: Friendly working environment, same way of thinking because of young workers.
cons: No clear vision, no clear working development, either in wage or anything else.

headline: Interesting prospects, but generally unprofessional.
pros: Decent pay, Good for Fresh Grads, Casual
cons: Politics, PRC overwhelming, employees with various disparity in professionalism, over hiring people.

headline: They don't really care about engineers, or at least that did happend a lot.
pros: Nah, not really any pros
cons: They don't really care about engineers, or at least that did happened a lot.

headline: Business Development Associate
pros: Great pantry, well-covered office welfare and perks, pays higher than market rate. Company is mostly PRCs, able to integrate easily. HR is very efficient.
cons: Lack of personal development programs, no work/life balance, they expect you to work almost 24 hrs! Lack of structured compulsory learning programs, not much of team bonding, people refuse to lend a helping hand. Office bullying is often.

headline: This is China! (*Management are all pseudo-Singaporean)
pros:
- Nice office, good amenities
- Young working environment
- No strict company guidelines. 
- Career advancement not based on age. 
- Mandarin is the lingua franca
- Feels like working in an MNC in Beijing. (>50% of workers are from PRC)
- Free history lesson (Office politics unfolds like China's Warlord Era: many factions (most staff are hired through referral, so they already knew each other beforehand)
cons:
- Very top-down, dictatorial style.
- Favors obedient employees, limits creativity and punishes outspoken employees.
- Unreasonable termination of employees 
- Very selfish and poor mid-management leadership
- No indigenous products from the company. (Every product is an imitation of a popular IP)

headline: Associate
pros: competitive salary, fast growing, learn more think more
cons: Stress overload unbalance life

headline: Meh
pros: Free flow snacks, nice office environment.. good chance to practice how to deal with difficult people
cons: "flat structure" is not equal to "no structure".. Whole bunch of inexperienced employees, no professional communication, no processes, not everyone speaks fluent English, no work life balance

headline: Consultant, Business Development
pros: One of the best places to work! Awesome office, fun people and a great team. Management team offers coaching and help if you're struggling.
cons: We work a lot. WORK HARD AND PLAY HARD. That's the only con I can think of for those who want more a work/life balance.

headline: Garena Ph
pros: Popularity to all gamers, in-game freebies , respected by other players
cons: Can't eat in the right time because of "Kota" , delayed salary *So much* , Office Team don't recognize Field Team's hard work

headline: Great as a stepping board
pros:
Fresh graduates get high starting salary as compared to any other similar company in the industry.

Opportunities will be given to those who is outstanding in the roles they perform.

Regionally recognized company, thus giving a great CV value for the time you spend there.
cons:
Strong Chinese culture that will need some adjusting to if you are unfamiliar with.

If you do not intend to be outstanding, you will have close to no career advancements.

headline: senior web developer
pros: It is good for fresh graduate to enjoy it.
cons: Not for long terms or future

headline: A cool internet company right here in Asia!
pros:
- For those who aspire to work for the likes of Google and Facebook, Garena is definitely comparable in every sense. From its employee perks to company growth potential, Garena is a leading internet company right here in Asia
- Management really cares about staff welfare and development
- Opportunities are there as long as one exhibit the potential and talent
- This place is like campus life after university. People are friendly, fun, relaxed, hardworking and passionate. No office politics and an overall flat organisational structure for those who dislike a rigid corporate life.
cons:
- Hours can be a little long as people here work longer hours to accomplish big projects 
- Given the nature of the internet industry (fast moving and rapidly changing), projects can sometimes change in nature or have moving targets.

headline: Great Place to Let Yourself Grow
pros:
Lots of opportunities: you will be put into important projects that can help you improve your working skills
Great working environment: the company provide very nice working environment + plenty nice facilities, food and snacks
Friendly working colleagues: the colleagues here are friendly for you to approach to if you have any question in work. Interactions between colleagues here are more like friends.
cons: work and life balance: hard to balance work and life here as the working hour is from 10 am to 8 pm.

headline: Fast growing company with a lot opportunities for fresh graduates
pros:
- Good working environment: Spacious pantry, unlimited food & beverage, great welfare, even provides sleeping pods and massage service 
- Young & vibrant culture: very easy to adapt in; colleagues are nice and friendly
- Flat organisational structure: Managers are easily to be approached; your opinions will be listened, regardless of your experience 
- A lot of opportunities for young talents: age or experience is not that important at Garena, you will take great responsibilities as long as you are good
cons:
- Long working hours, but heavily depends on the workload of specific projects 
- Lack of personal development programs, but the management team is paying more attention to this and trying to improve it

headline: Great place to start your career
pros:
Great working culture: unlike some big companies with rigid structure, you are entitled to have great decision power in your roles. 
Friendly colleagues: colleagues are easy going and supportive. You may approach them if you have any questions
Rewarding: company will reward you and give you plenty of opportunities if you're capable and motivated
cons: Work-life balance: working hours start late (~10am) and end late (8pm+) as well.

headline: A very supportive environment for fresh graduates
pros:
- spacious office and impressive pantry; you get magnum ice-cream everyday
- friendly culture and very supportive colleagues
- straight forward kind of working culture
cons: - longer working hour: even though work starts late, it normally ends late as well.

headline: Fast moving, great challenges and learning
pros:
Fast pace, efficient working environment
Good for learning new things and try out new ideas
Good working environment
Friendly peers to work together
cons:
Limited career advancement perspective
Not much work-life balance

headline: Lots of Opportunities to grow fast
pros:
The company is young and a lot of fresh graduates are hired. In fact, most of the front end roles are managed by these young minds. The management values the ideas and initiatives taken and there are lots of opportunities to grow.
The company culture is fast-paced, yet relaxed. Periodic training and meetings with the management helps you know which direction you're going in. Interaction is key and the young  and vibrant atmosphere in the company motivates you to work and prove yourself.
Not to forget, the company knows how to take care of its employees. Weekly welfare, free drinks, food, a pool table, air hockey, etc only adds to the dynamism.  I have a lot of friends who work in all sorts of industries and companies. None have such facilities.
cons: The growth here is quick and if you do well, you can reach your peak quickly. On the other hand, similar to other companies, you might be stuck at your current position because there might not be any suitable position for your manager to be promoted to.

headline: Regional MD
pros: Visionary leadership. Excellent and collaborative working environment. The teams are very focused on getting things done and have a very pragmatic way to execution that is needed for success. Very demanding in terms of effort put in but typically with good results to show
cons: Demanding working environment for people who are serious about their work

headline: Great place if you're willing to work hard
pros: The leadership here is amazing, if you understand what they are trying to do. Fantastic people; everyone is willing to help if you just ask. Great compensation. Really great benefits packages!
cons: Difficult work/life balance for some people. You do need to work really hard on both technical work and reaching out to people to get things done. Coordination between different teams requite a lot of communication. Most of my days were from 10:30am to around 9-10pm.

headline: Used to be a nice place to stay
pros:
- Had nice working environment
- Easy to join if you come from competitor company, graduate from foreign university, and have perfect degree
- Biggest IT company in SEA
cons:
- Now it doesn't have a good working atmosphere
- Too much politics
- If you're local then you won't have future in this company. Management seats are exclusive for Singaporean and locals who graduated from Singapore university
- Low salary, no overtime fee
- Long working hour
- Unbalanced task
- No standardization

headline: Not the best place for staying long
pros:
Big IT company
Fun workplace
Friendly people
cons:
No long term plan
Execute before making any plan
No risk management
Management can't keep up with the fast growing company

headline: Only good for fresh graduated that seeking work experiences. Doesn't recommend for long term career.
pros:
- Friendly staff overall (like a family)
- One of the biggest company in SEA (good for resume)
- Flexible working condition
cons:
- Too much politics
- Local staff doesn't have chance in career development (all head positions is either from SG or someone that graduated from SG univ)
- No fixed plan for they future projects/marketing
- No intensive Q&A for the products they want to launch
- No SOP. Often become chaotic when launching new product
- Unrealistic goal & deadline. A one week project often must be done in 1 or 2 day
- No KPI to keep track of your own progress/development

headline: Disappointed already
pros: Have a good experience working in biggest IT company in SEA
cons:
No Planning
No Leadership
No Communication
No Career Path
No Procedure
No Culture

headline: Product specialist
pros:
Convinient work schedule
Gaming company
Friendly bunch
cons:
Political
hard to move up
not clear business plan

headline: Good and bad mixed.
pros: lot of good ppl, depends what dept you are in. Some dept full of bad ppl & nasty boss.
cons:
Not a good place for long term career.
Salary is below market pay compare to gov/finance/IT sectors.
No OT reimbursement.

headline: Friendly company
pros: Little to no office politics, people play nice with each other, a lot of talented people (ex McKinsey, IBM, Unilever, Zalora), good welfare and pantry supply
cons: Late working hours (7pm), not everyone can speak English fluently

headline: Only good for fresher
pros:
-Fast Growing
-One of the biggest IT company in SEA
cons:
-No direction
-No transparency
-No culture
-No procedure
-No planning

headline: generally good
pros: very good welfare every week
cons: workload is too small even for internship

headline: no annual bonus, no position improvement, little salary increase
pros: most people are Chinese, you can speak chinese at most of the time. Actually this is a singapore based chinese company.
cons: no annual bonus, no overtime reimbursements, no company culture, liitle salary increase. If you want a easy job, Garena is best place for you. But if you want to learn or make money, ... then forget it

headline: Not pleasant environment
pros: Great opportunity to learn new stuff.
cons: Dominated by chinese mainland staffs, mostly chinese speaking environment with chinese technical terms. Management can be unresponsive or unreasonable when queried about how things are done or to be done.

headline: Great working place
pros:
Can work with stunning talented people together.
It's the best place for developers/programmers to learn and grow quickly
cons: Company grows too fast and there is no procedures which can be adapt to the fast step.

headline: Garena DJing
pros: I get to interact with people at the comfort of my own home
cons: The hours put is is quite little. It gets a little intrusive when a lot of people start to know you.

headline: Work hard, play hard!
pros:
Tremendous opportunities for fresh grads
Friendly and fun environment
Flat structure
Long lunch hours
Fast growing
A lot of young, talented and passionate ppl
Caring and down-to-earth bosses
cons:
Lack of structure
Lack of formal training - more learning on the job
Sometimes the workers use Chinese to communicate with each other

headline: Need improvement on lot of things, "interesting" bosses
pros:
I am a current employee who worked for Garena more than one years. So far I have to say the company has quite strong development team, based on my personal experience on other local technology companies(Based on the technology they use and the way they develop their own kind of frameworks and tools). 

In this company, as a developer, you will always be challenged by various issues proposed by various kind of bosses, managers and designers.
cons:
The company is growing too fast in its size and still keeping its way of management like a start up. Some of the points from management layers are not so "making-sense". You might be asked to pend the current job and finish another urgent large amount of work within one or two days.

Not so good compensation( in fact , compared to the long working hour). Some times I have to go to company in weekend

No english speaking in most of the team, since most of the people are from China. Basically It is a kind of traditional "family business" style company.
